ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Global Repository
MWS2R2 - AD Rename Computer
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Rename Computer # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: COMPONENTID, INSTANCEID # Description: # # Renames a computer based on MWS2 naming standard # Registers the computername and IP address in the key value store # Downloads common and computer specific files from the deployment file share # Resets the local administrator account password to a random value # Registers the password in the key value share # Updates the instance name in AWS
. .\GlobalRepository.ps1
$ComponentID = $COMPONENTID $InstanceID = $INSTANCEID
$CustomerID = (get-globalvariable "Global/CustomerID").value $LocationID = (get-globalvariable "Global/LocationID").value
$Computername = $($CustomerID + $ComponentID + $LocationID + $InstanceID + "W") write-output "Setting computername to $Computername" Rename-Computer -NewName $Computername -force
write-output "Storing IP Address in key value store" $key = 'Network/{0}' -f $Computername $ip = Get-NetIPAddress | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.AddressFamily -eq "IPv4" } | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.IPAddress -ne "127.0.0.1"} $ipa = $ip.IPAddress Set-globalvariable $key $ipa
write-output "Downloading common files and computer files from repository"
get-files "$ComponentID$InstanceID"
write-output "Resetting local administrator password" . .\New-RandomPassword.ps1 $password = new-randompassword -PasswordLength 10 $adminUser = [ADSI] "WinNT://./SOE-LOAD,User" $adminUser.SetPassword($password) Set-globalvariable "Administrator/$Computername" $password
#register name tag #write-output "Registering AWS name tag" #$aid = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/instance-id #$uri = "http://10.0.0.23:5000/p1/" + $aid + "?tagname=" + $Computername #Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Method Put
write-output "Restarting computer"

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Create Active Directory
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Create Active Directory # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Installs Active Directory Role and Management Tools # Runs DC Promo to create the resource domain # Registers the DCs IP address in the key value store as Primary DNS server
#include dynamic data store # Load Common functions . .\Logging.ps1 . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1
write-output "Installing Active Roles Management." Start-Process "msiexec.exe" -ArgumentList "-i $scriptPath\ActiveRolesManagementShell_x64_1.6.0.msi /q"-Wait write-output "Active Roles Management installed."
#install roles and features
$addsTools = "RSAT-AD-Tools"
Add-WindowsFeature $addsTools #Install AD DS, DNS and GPMC
start-job -Name addFeature -ScriptBlock { Add-WindowsFeature -Name "ad-domain-services" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools Add-WindowsFeature -Name "dns" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools Add-WindowsFeature -Name "gpmc" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools } Wait-Job -Name addFeature
# Create New Forest, add Domain Controller
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global/DomainFQDN").value $netbiosName = (get-globalvariable "Global/DomainNetBIOS").value $dsrmPassword = (get-globalvariable "Global/DomainDSRMPassword").value $secure_string_pwd = convertto-securestring $dsrmPassword -asplaintext -force
write-output "Domainname: $domainname [$netbiosname]"
Import-Module ADDSDeployment Install-ADDSForest -CreateDnsDelegation:$false ` -DatabasePath "E:\NTDS-DB" ` -DomainMode "Win2012" ` -DomainName $domainname ` -DomainNetbiosName $netbiosName ` -SafeModeAdministratorPassword $secure_string_pwd ` -ForestMode "Win2012" ` -InstallDns:$true ` -LogPath "L:\NTDS-Logs" ` -NoRebootOnCompletion:$true ` -SysvolPath "E:\SYSVOL" ` -Force:$true `
$dynamicdata = "AD\PrimaryDNS" $ip = Get-NetIPAddress | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.AddressFamily -eq "IPv4" } | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.IPAddress -ne "127.0.0.1"} $ipa = $ip.IPAddress Set-globalvariable $dynamicdata $ipa
write-output "Sleeping for 2 minutes" Start-Sleep -s 120 write-output "Done"

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Configure Active Directory
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Configure Active Directory # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Creates OU Structure # Creates Service Accounts and stores passwords in key value store # Store domain dn in key value store for later use
. .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\new-randompassword.ps1 Start-Sleep -s 120
$scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name #Saving Domain Details in key-value store
$d = get-addomain Set-GlobalVariable "AD/DistinguishedName" $d.DistinguishedName
write-output "Installing Active Roles Management." Start-Process "msiexec.exe" -ArgumentList "-i $scriptPath\ActiveRolesManagementShell_x64_1.6.0.msi /q"-Wait write-output "Active Roles Management installed."
. .\1_MWS_OUimport.ps1 . .\2_MWS_PERMGroupsPerOU.ps1 . .\3_MWS_ApplyPERMGroupstoOU.ps1
$username = (get-globalvariable "Global\DeploymentUsername").value $description = "Agility Deployment Account" $password = (get-globalvariable "Global\DeploymentPassword").value
function CreateServiceAccount([string]$username, [string]$description,[string]$password){
if(!$password){ $password = new-randompassword -PasswordLength 16 }
$User = Get-ADUser -Filter {sAMAccountName -eq $username} If ($User -eq $Null) {"User does not currently exist in AD"} Else { "[SKIP] User found in AD" return }
$dom = Get-ADDomain $dn = $dom.DistinguishedName
New-ADUser $username ` -Path "ou=admin service accounts,ou=Administration,$dn" ` -Enable:$true ` -PasswordNeverExpires:$true ` -Description $description ` -AccountPassword (ConvertTo-SecureString $password -AsPlainText -Force)
Set-GlobalVariable "ServiceAccount/$username" $password
}
function AddUsertoDomainGroup([string]$username, [string]$groupname){
Add-ADGroupMember $groupname $username }
$scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
write-output "Adding AD management tools if required." $addsTools = "RSAT-AD-Tools" Add-WindowsFeature $addsTools
Import-Module ActiveDirectory
CreateServiceAccount -username $username -description $description -password $password CreateServiceAccount -username "aws_mws_em_admin" -description "SQL - EM" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_sql" -description "SQL - Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_ssas" -description "SSAS - Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_ssis" -description "SSIS - Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_ssrs" -description "SSRS - Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_farm" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_Services" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_WebAppPool" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_Content" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_UserProfile" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_SuperUser" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_SuperReader" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_Excel" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_PerfPoint" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_Access" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_Workflow" -description "Sharepoint" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sql" -description "Generic SQL" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc-sharefile" -description "Sharefile Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "service.exchange" -description "Exchange Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sccm_install" -description "SCCM Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sccm_sql" -description "SCCM SQL Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sccm_sup" -description "SCCM SUP Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_em_install" -description "EM install Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_fim" -description "FIM Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_xdm" -description "XDM Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_search" -description "Sharepoint Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_sp_visio" -description "Sharepoint Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "svc_mysitesapppool" -description "Sharepoint Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "z-da-sql-omdwritr" -description "SCOM Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "z-da-sql-omdredr" -description "SCOM Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "z-da-om-csda" -description "SCOM Service Account" CreateServiceAccount -username "z-da-omsrva" -description "SCOM Service Account"
AddUserToDomainGroup "service.exchange" "enterprise admins" AddUserToDomainGroup "service.exchange" "domain admins" AddUserToDomainGroup "service.exchange" "enterprise admins" AddUserToDomainGroup "service.exchange" "schema admins" AddUserToDomainGroup "svc_sccm_install" "schema admins"
AddUserToDomainGroup $username "domain admins"
# Agility user must be enterprise admin for recycle bin enable $currentuser = "$env:USERNAME" AddUserToDomainGroup $currentuser "enterprise admins" AddUserToDomainGroup $currentuser "schema admins"
Exit $LastExitCode

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD DSSOE
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
write-output "Starting DSSOE Install" # Load Common functions . .\\Logging.ps1 . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\\FilesUtility.ps1
Start-Sleep -s 120
$scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainFQDN").value $domainNB = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainNetBIOS").value $dn = (get-globalvariable "AD\DistinguishedName").value
write-output "Installing Agility Deployment Group Policy." Write-output "Creating Agility deployment policy" $gpOut = new-gpo -name AgilityDeploymentPolicy -domain $domainname | new-gplink -target $dn -Order 1 -Enforced Yes -domain $domainname write-output "$gpOut" $gpOut = import-gpo -BackupId F2837B33-191B-4677-A964-FA6DA1398A79 -TargetName AgilityDeploymentPolicy -path "$scriptPath\AgilityGPO" Write-output "$gpOut" write-output "Agility Deployment Policy created and linked"
#write-output "Installing Active Roles Management." #Start-Process "msiexec.exe" -ArgumentList "-i $scriptPath\ActiveRolesManagementShell_x64_1.6.0.msi /q"-Wait #write-output "Active Roles Management installed."
write-output "Installing DSSOE." cd DSSOE Start-Process "powershell.exe" -ArgumentList "-executionpolicy bypass $scriptPath\dssoe\dsconfig.ps1"-Wait write-output "DSSOE Installed."
#write-output "Disabling DSSOE Domain Controller Policy" #$dcou = (Get-ADDomain).DomainControllersContainer #foreach( $gpol in (Get-GPInheritance -Target $dcou).gpolinks){ # if($gpol.DisplayName -eq 'OU-B-CSCBaselineDomainControllerPolicy'){ # $gpol.Enabled = $false # } #}

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Exchange Copy Install Files
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: Exchange Install Files # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Downloads exchange installation medi from the deployment share
Write-Host "Starting MWS2-Exchange Install Files" # Load Common functions . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1
Write-Host "$((Get-Date).ToString()) : Sleeping for 2 minutes" Start-Sleep -s 120
Write-Host "$((Get-Date).ToString()) : Copying files." Get-AppFiles "Exchange2013SP1"
If ($Error.Count -gt 0) { ForEach ($E in $Error) { Write-Host "ERROR: $($E.Exception.Message)" } Write-Host "Completed MWS2-Exchange Install Files" Exit -1 } Else { Write-Host "Completed MWS2-Exchange Install Files" Exit 0 }

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Exchange Schema Update
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: Exchange Schema Update # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Unattened Exchange schema update, running as exchange service account
write-output "Starting" # Load Common functions . .\\LoggingV2.ps1 -newVersion $True . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\\FilesUtility.ps1
#get-appfiles "Exchange2013SP1"
$username = "service.exchange" $password = (get-globalvariable("ServiceAccount\\$username")).value
# Launch process LaunchProcessAsUser "$scriptPath\\Exchange2013SP1\\setup.exe" "/ps /IAcceptExchangeServerLicenseTerms" $username $password
Start-Sleep -Seconds 120

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Exchange Domain Prep
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: Exchange Domain Prep # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Unattended Exchange domain prep - running as exchange service account
write-output "Starting" # Load Common functions . .\\LoggingV2.ps1 -newVersion $True . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\\FilesUtility.ps1
$username = "service.exchange" $password = (get-globalvariable("ServiceAccount\\$username")).value $org = (get-globalvariable("Global\\DomainNetBIOS")).value
$Result = LaunchProcessAsUser "$scriptPath\\Exchange2013SP1\\setup.exe" "/p /on:$org /IAcceptExchangeServerLicenseTerms" $username $password
Write-Output "LaunchProcessAsUser completed with return code [$Result]" Exit $Result

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD SCCM Schema
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
write-output "Starting SCCM Schema" # Load Common functions . .\\Logging.ps1 . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\\FilesUtility.ps1
$scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainFQDN").value $domainNB = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainNetBIOS").value $dn = (get-globalvariable "AD\DistinguishedName").value
Start-Sleep -s 120
write-output "Extending Schema" .\extadsch.exe
write-output "Creating System Management Container" import-module ActiveDirectory
$cn = New-ADObject -Type Container -name "System Management" -Path "CN=System,$((Get-ADDomain).DistinguishedName)" $acl = get-acl "ad:CN=System Management,CN=System,$((Get-ADDomain).DistinguishedName)" $user = get-aduser "svc_sccm_install" $sid = [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] $user.SID
$ActiveDirectoryRights = "GenericAll" $AccessControlType = "Allow" $Inherit = "SelfAndChildren" $nullGUID = [guid]'00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000'
$ace = New-Object System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAccessRule $sid, $ActiveDirectoryRights, $AccessControlType, $Inherit, $nullGUID $acl.AddAccessRule($ace) Set-acl -aclobject $acl "ad:CN=System Management,CN=System,$((Get-ADDomain).DistinguishedName)"
write-output "Completed SCCM Schema"

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD MWS Policies
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
write-output "Starting MWS Policies" # Load Common functions . .\\Logging.ps1 . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\\FilesUtility.ps1
Start-Sleep -s 120
$scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainFQDN").value $domainNB = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainNetBIOS").value $dn = (get-globalvariable "AD\DistinguishedName").value
write-output "Creating folders" MD e:\Admin MD e:\Scripts
write-output "Creating reserve file" fsutil file createnew e:\reservefile 512000000
write-output "Restricting RPC Port Ranges" MD HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet -Name Ports -PropertyType MultiString -Value "49152-49407" New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet -Name PortsInternetAvailable -PropertyType String -Value "Y" New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet -Name UseInternetPorts -PropertyType String -Value "Y"
write-output "Installing MWS Audit Settings." . .\MWS-ImportAuditSettings.ps1
write-output "Installing MWS Domain Group Policy." $gpOut = new-gpo -name MWSDomainPolicy -domain $domainname | new-gplink -target $dn -Order 1 -domain $domainname $gpOut = import-gpo -BackupId 49b08726-736b-471c-af44-a7882cc552d9 -TargetName MWSDomainPolicy -path "$scriptPath\MWSGPO" write-output "MWS Domain Group Policy created and linked"
write-output "Installing MWS Domain Controller Group Policy." $gpOut = new-gpo -name MWSDomainControllerPolicy -domain $domainname | new-gplink -target "ou=Domain Controllers,$dn" -Order 1 -domain $domainname $gpOut = import-gpo -BackupId BD6FFD6A-2094-4E7F-9FB8-382C1D978952 -TargetName MWSDomainControllerPolicy -path "$scriptPath\MWSGPO" write-output "MWS Domain Controller Group Policy created and linked"
write-output "Installing MWS Member Server Group Policy." $gpOut = new-gpo -name MWSMemberServerPolicy -domain $domainname | new-gplink -target "ou=Servers,ou=Customer,$dn" -Order 1 -domain $domainname $gpOut = import-gpo -BackupId f4b545e5-4a1a-4248-bb5d-b9b9aeb6ae79 -TargetName MWSMemberServerPolicy -path "$scriptPath\MWSGPO" write-output "MWS Member Server Group Policy created and linked"
write-output "Adding Exchange servers group to PERM-D-DCSecurityLogManager" Add-ADGroupMember 'PERM-D-DCSecurityLogManager' 'Exchange Servers'
write-output "Enabling Recycle Bin" Enable-ADOptionalFeature 'Recycle Bin Feature' -Scope ForestOrConfigurationSet -Target $domainname -confirm:$false
write-output "Setting Domain Password Object" New-ADFineGrainedPasswordPolicy -Name "DomainUsersPSO" -Precedence 10 -Description "Domain Users Password Policy" -DisplayName "Domain Users PSO" -MinPasswordLength 15 -LockoutDuration "0.00:04:00" -LockoutObservationWindow "0.00:04:00" -LockoutThreshold 4 -PasswordHistoryCount 6 -ReversibleEncryptionEnabled $false -ComplexityEnabled $true -MinPasswordAge "1.00:00:00" -MaxPasswordAge "60.00:00:00" Add-ADFineGrainedPasswordPolicySubject DomainUsersPSO -Subjects 'Domain Users'
write-output "MWS Policies Installed."

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Assign Replicate Dir Changes
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:description: Assignes Replicate Directory Changes to a given account. This is required by SharePoint 2013 to support user Profiles synchronisation.

ns1:install.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Assign Replicate Dir Changes

ns1:operational.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Assign Replicate Dir Changes

ns1:Asset.ns1:description: CSC SOE 6.1.1 Agility-MWS2 CDC MS Private Cloud:

ns1:targets.ns1:name: CSC SOE 6.1.1 Agility-MWS2 CDC MS Private Cloud

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Add Domain Controller
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Add Domain Controller # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Adds a second domain controller to the resource domain
#include dynamic data store # Load Common functions . .\Logging.ps1 . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1
write-output "Restricting RPC Port Ranges" MD HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet -Name Ports -PropertyType MultiString -Value "49152-49407" New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet -Name PortsInternetAvailable -PropertyType String -Value "Y" New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Rpc\Internet -Name UseInternetPorts -PropertyType String -Value "Y"
write-output "Creating folders" MD e:\Admin MD e:\Scripts
write-output "Creating reserve file" fsutil file createnew e:\reservefile 512000000
#install roles and features
$addsTools = "RSAT-AD-Tools"
Add-WindowsFeature $addsTools
#Install AD DS, DNS and GPMC
start-job -Name addFeature -ScriptBlock { Add-WindowsFeature -Name "ad-domain-services" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools Add-WindowsFeature -Name "dns" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools Add-WindowsFeature -Name "gpmc" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools } Wait-Job -Name addFeature
# Create New Forest, add Domain Controller
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainFQDN").value $domainNB = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainNetBIOS").value $domainjoin_short_username = (get-globalvariable "Global\DeploymentUsername").value $domainjoinusername = "$domainNB\$domainjoin_short_username" $domainjoinpassword = (get-globalvariable "Global\DeploymentPassword").value $dsrmPassword = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainDSRMPassword").value write-output "Adding DC to " $domainname " using account " $domainjoinusername
$dnsip = (get-globalvariable "AD\PrimaryDNS").value write-output "setting primary dns to $dnsip" $na=Get-NetAdapter -Physical | where status -eq 'up' Set-DnsClientServerAddress -InterfaceIndex $na.ifIndex -ServerAddresses ($dnsip,"127.0.0.1")
$secure_dsrm_pwd = convertto-securestring $dsrmPassword -asplaintext -force $secure_dj_pwd = convertto-securestring $domainjoinpassword -asplaintext -force
$cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ` -argumentlist $domainjoinusername, $secure_dj_pwd
Import-Module ADDSDeployment Install-ADDSDomainController ` -NoGlobalCatalog:$false ` -CreateDnsDelegation:$False ` -Credential $cred ` -CriticalReplicationOnly:$false ` -DatabasePath "E:\NTDS-DB" ` -DomainName $domainname ` -SafeModeAdministratorPassword $secure_dsrm_pwd ` -InstallDns:$True ` -LogPath "L:\NTDS-Logs" ` -NoRebootOnCompletion:$true ` -SysvolPath "E:\SYSVOL" ` -Force:$true ` -Confirm:$false
$ip = Get-NetIPAddress | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.AddressFamily -eq "IPv4" } | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.IPAddress -ne "127.0.0.1"} $ipa = $ip.IPAddress Set-GlobalVariable "AD\SecondaryDNS" $ip.IPAddress

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Additional DC DSSOE and Active Roles Management
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
write-output "Starting Active Roles Management and DSSOE Install" # Load Common functions . .\\Logging.ps1 . .\\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\\FilesUtility.ps1
$scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainFQDN").value $domainNB = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainNetBIOS").value $dn = (get-globalvariable "AD\DistinguishedName").value
write-output "Installing Active Roles Management." Start-Process "msiexec.exe" -ArgumentList "-i $scriptPath\ActiveRolesManagementShell_x64_1.6.0.msi /q"-Wait write-output "Active Roles Management installed."
write-output "Installing DSSOE." cd DSSOE Start-Process "powershell.exe" -ArgumentList "-executionpolicy bypass $scriptPath\dssoe\dsconfig.ps1"-Wait write-output "DSSOE Installed."

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Add Additional Domain Controller

ns1:operational.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Additional DC DSSOE and Active Roles Management
